Package org.unibl.etf.calculator

Class CalculatorAdvanced

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.unibl.etf.calculator.Calculator
      • org.unibl.etf.calculator.CalculatorAdvanced
  • public class CalculatorAdvanced
extends Calculator
    Represents a class used for advanced calculations, extends Calculator class. Supports factorial and graduation computation, as well as checking if a number is Armstrong or perfect number.
    Since:
    2023-11-21
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Novica Tepic

    • Constructor Detail

      • CalculatorAdvanced

        public CalculatorAdvanced()

    • Method Detail

      • calculateAdvanced

        public void calculateAdvanced​(char action)
                       throws NotSupportedOperationException,
                              NumberNotInAreaException
        Calculates factorial or graduation of a number based on action parameter. Factorial is calculated only if current value in the calculator is between 0 and 10 and the action parameter is '!'. Graduation is calculated only if action parameter is between '0' and '9'.
        Parameters:
        action - Character based on which calculator performs operations, valid characters are '!' and between '0' and '9'.
        Throws:
        NotSupportedOperationException - Thrown if operation is not '!' or is not between '0' and '9'.
        NumberNotInAreaException - Thrown if the current value in the calculator is not between 0 and 10 when performing factorial operation.

      • hasCharacteristic

        public java.lang.Boolean hasCharacteristic​(char value)
                                    throws NumberNotInAreaException,
                                           NotSupportedOperationException
        Returns whether the integer part of the number is Armstrong number or a perfect number.
        Parameters:
        value - Character which determines whether to check if a number is Armstrong number or a number is a perfect number. For Armstrong valid character is 'A', for perfect it is 'P'.
        Returns:
        true if the current value in the calculator meets required conditions, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        NumberNotInAreaException - Thrown if the current value in the calculator is less than 1.
        NotSupportedOperationException - Thrown if parameter of the method is different from 'A' or 'P'.
